meanings.definition: To express good wishes or congratulations
meanings.sent1: I felicitate you on your graduation!
meanings.sent2: Let's felicitate Sarah on her promotion at work.
meanings.sent3: The whole town came together to felicitate the newlyweds.
meanings.sent4: Her smile could felicitate even the grumpiest of people.
meanings.sent5: The warm hug from her grandmother seemed to felicitate her heart.

meanings.sent1: The surprise party really felicitated him.
meanings.sent2: Music has the power to felicitate our souls.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's playful antics never failed to felicitate the children.
meanings.sent4: The beautiful sunset seemed to felicitate the entire beach.
meanings.sent5: Her laughter could felicitate a room in an instant.
